US Federal & Government Frameworks

Compliance requirements for federal agencies, government contractors, and defense contractors

NIST Cybersecurity Framework 2.0 CRITICAL

Comprehensive cybersecurity risk management framework with 6 core functions

Key Controls:
  • Identify - Asset management, risk assessment, governance
  • Protect - Access control, data security, maintenance
  • Detect - Anomalies, continuous monitoring
  • Respond - Response planning, communications
  • Recover - Recovery planning, improvements
  • Govern (NEW) - Strategy, roles, oversight
108 Controls 6 Functions Updated 2024
NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 CRITICAL

Security and privacy controls for federal information systems

Control Families:
  • AC - Access Control (25 controls)
  • AU - Audit and Accountability (14 controls)
  • CM - Configuration Management (9 controls)
  • IA - Identification and Authentication (10 controls)
  • IR - Incident Response (8 controls)
  • MA - Maintenance (6 controls)
  • MP - Media Protection (8 controls)
  • PE - Physical Protection (24 controls)
  • PL - Planning (6 controls)
  • PM - Program Management (23 controls)
  • PS - Personnel Security (7 controls)
  • RA - Risk Assessment (6 controls)
  • SA - System and Services Acquisition (11 controls)
  • SC - System and Communications Protection (46 controls)
  • SI - System and Information Integrity (14 controls)
  • SR - Supply Chain Risk Management (10 controls)
  • Privacy - Privacy Control (43 controls)
NIST SP 800-171 CRITICAL

Protection of Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) in non-federal systems

Security Requirements:
  • Access Control - 22 controls
  • Awareness and Training - 4 controls
  • Audit and Accountability - 7 controls
  • Configuration Management - 6 controls
  • Identification and Authentication - 6 controls
  • Incident Response - 4 controls
  • Maintenance - 3 controls
  • Media Protection - 6 controls
  • Personnel Security - 4 controls
  • Physical Protection - 6 controls
  • Risk Assessment - 3 controls
  • Security Assessment - 4 controls
  • System and Communications Protection - 25 controls
  • System and Information Integrity - 7 controls
FedRAMP CRITICAL

Cloud security assessment program for federal agencies

Requirements:
  • System Security Plan (SSP) development
  • NIST 800-53 controls implementation
  • Third-party Assessment (3PAO)
  • Continuous monitoring requirements
  • Incident response and reporting
  • Annual assessment and authorization
  • Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M)
Low Impact Moderate Impact High Impact
CMMC 2.0 CRITICAL

Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification for DoD contractors

Three Maturity Levels:
  • Level 1 (Foundational): 17 practices - Basic cyber hygiene
  • Level 2 (Advanced): 110 practices - NIST 800-171 controls
  • Level 3 (Expert): 130+ practices - Advanced threats
Domains:
  • Access Control (AC), Audit & Accountability (AU)
  • Identification & Authentication (IA), System & Communications (SC)
  • System & Information Integrity (SI), Risk Management (RM)
FISMA HIGH

Federal Information Security Management Act requirements

Key Requirements:
  • Information security program development
  • Periodic risk assessments
  • Security policies and procedures
  • Security awareness training
  • Periodic testing and evaluation
  • Processes for remediation
  • Detection and response procedures

International Privacy & Data Protection

Global data protection regulations and privacy laws across jurisdictions

GDPR CRITICAL

EU General Data Protection Regulation

Key Principles:
  • Lawfulness, fairness, transparency
  • Purpose limitation and data minimization
  • Accuracy, storage limitation, integrity
  • Data subject rights (access, rectification, erasure)
  • Right to be forgotten, data portability
  • Privacy by design and by default
Penalties:
  • Up to 20 million or 4% of global annual revenue
CCPA/CPRA CRITICAL

California Consumer Privacy Act (with CPRA amendments)

Consumer Rights:
  • Right to know about personal information collected
  • Right to delete personal information
  • Right to opt-out of sale/share of personal information
  • Right to non-discrimination for exercising rights
  • Right to correct inaccurate information
  • Limit use of sensitive personal information
Penalties:
  • $2,500-$7,500 per intentional violation
LGPD CRITICAL

Brazilian General Data Protection Law

Key Requirements:
  • Legal basis for processing (consent, contract, legal obligation)
  • Data subject rights (access, correction, deletion)
  • Data protection officer (DPO) appointment
  • Data protection impact assessments
  • Incident notification within 3 days
  • Data processing records maintenance
PIPL HIGH

China Personal Information Protection Law

Key Requirements:
  • Consent-based processing of personal information
  • Data subject rights (access, correction, deletion)
  • Cross-border data transfer restrictions
  • Security measures and breach notification
  • Data localization for critical operators
  • Algorithms and automated decision-making rules
DPDP Act HIGH

India Digital Personal Data Protection Act (2025)

Key Requirements:
  • Consent for processing personal data
  • Data subject rights (access, correction, erasure)
  • Data protection officer appointment
  • Data breach notification (72 hours)
  • Cross-border data transfer restrictions
  • Significant data fiduciary requirements
PIPEDA HIGH

Canada Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act

Key Principles:
  • Accountability and consent
  • Purpose identification and limitation
  • Collection limitation and accuracy
  • Use, disclosure, and retention
  • Individual access rights
  • Safeguards and openness

Financial Services & AML

Banking, securities, and anti-money laundering compliance requirements

SOX CRITICAL

Sarbanes-Oxley Act - Financial reporting controls

Key Sections:
  • Section 302: CEO/CFO certification of financial statements
  • Section 404: Internal controls over financial reporting
  • Section 409: Real-time disclosure requirements
  • Section 802: Criminal penalties for destruction of records
  • Section 906: CEO/CFO certification of periodic reports
IT Controls:
  • Access controls, change management
  • Data integrity, backup and recovery
  • Segregation of duties
BSA/AML CRITICAL

Bank Secrecy Act and Anti-Money Laundering requirements

Key Requirements:
  • Customer Due Diligence (CDD)
  • Know Your Customer (KYC)
  • Suspicious Activity Reporting (SAR)
  • Currency Transaction Reporting (CTR)
  • FinCEN 314(a) requests response
  • Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) compliance
  • Transaction monitoring systems
  • Enhanced due diligence for high-risk customers
PCI DSS 4.0 CRITICAL

Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard

12 Requirements:
  • Install and maintain network firewall configurations
  • Do not use vendor-supplied defaults for passwords
  • Protect stored cardholder data
  • Encrypt transmission of cardholder data
  • Use and regularly update antivirus software
  • Develop and maintain secure systems and applications
  • Restrict access to cardholder data by business need
  • Assign a unique ID to each person with computer access
  • Restrict physical access to cardholder data
  • Track and monitor all access to network resources
  • Regularly test security systems and processes
  • Maintain a policy that addresses information security
DORA CRITICAL

EU Digital Operational Resilience Act (Effective January 2025)

Key Requirements:
  • ICT risk management framework
  • Digital operational resilience testing
  • ICT-related incident management and reporting
  • Major ICT-related incident reporting (24 hours)
  • Critical ICT third-party provider oversight
  • ICT concentration risk management
  • Information and communication technology agreements
Effective Jan 2025

Healthcare Regulations

Healthcare privacy, safety, and regulatory compliance requirements

HIPAA CRITICAL

Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act

Three Rules:
  • Privacy Rule: PHI use and disclosure
  • Security Rule: ePHI safeguards (administrative, physical, technical)
  • Breach Notification Rule: 60-day notification requirement
Administrative Safeguards:
  • Security management, workforce security
  • Access management, security awareness training
  • Contingency planning, evaluation
HITECH Act CRITICAL

Health Information Technology for Economic and Clinical Health

Key Provisions:
  • Breach notification requirements
  • Enhanced HIPAA enforcement
  • Business Associate liability
  • Patient right to electronic health records
  • Health information technology adoption incentives
Penalties:
  • Tiered penalties from $100-$50,000 per violation
  • Maximum $1.5 million per year for same violation
HITRUST CSF HIGH

Unified healthcare security framework (combines HIPAA, NIST, ISO, PCI)

Control Categories:
  • Targeted Risk Management
  • Implementation Maturity Levels (L1-L3)
  • Assessment Types (self, validated, certified)
Mapped Standards:
  • HIPAA Security Rule
  • NIST SP 800-53, ISO 27001/27002
  • PCI DSS, SOC 2
21 CFR Part 11 HIGH

FDA electronic records and signatures compliance

Key Requirements:
  • Audit trails for all changes
  • Electronic signatures linked to user ID
  • System validation documentation
  • Access controls and authorization
  • Data backup and recovery procedures
  • Procedures for handling system failures

Industrial & Operational Technology

Industrial control systems, critical infrastructure, and export control compliance

IEC 62443 CRITICAL

Industrial automation and control systems cybersecurity

Security Zones and Conduits:
  • Zone 0 - Basic process control level
  • Zone 1 - Area supervisory control
  • Zone 2 - Operations control
  • Zone 3 - Site business planning
Security Levels (SL):
  • SL 1 - Protection against casual
  • SL 2 - Protection against intentional
  • SL 3 - Protection against sophisticated
  • SL 4 - Protection against extreme
NERC-CIP CRITICAL

Critical Infrastructure Protection for power grid and utilities

CIP Standards:
  • CIP-002 - BES Cyber System Categorization
  • CIP-003 - Security Management Controls
  • CIP-004 - Personnel and Training
  • CIP-005 - Electronic Security Perimeter
  • CIP-006 - Physical Security of BES Cyber Systems
  • CIP-007 - Systems Security Management
  • CIP-008 - Incident Reporting and Response
  • CIP-009 - Recovery Plans for BES Cyber Systems
  • CIP-010 - Configuration Change Management
  • CIP-011 - Information Protection
ISO 22301 HIGH

Business Continuity Management Systems standard

Key Elements:
  • Business impact analysis (BIA)
  • Risk assessment and treatment
  • Business continuity strategy
  • BCP and incident response plans
  • Exercising and testing
  • Performance measurement and review
  • Continual improvement
ITAR/EAR CRITICAL

Export controls - International Traffic in Arms Regulations / Export Administration Regulations

ITAR Requirements:
  • Registration with DDTC
  • Empowered Official designation
  • Export licenses and agreements
  • Defense Article protection (Section 120.1-120.15)
  • Technical data restrictions
EAR Requirements:
  • ECCN classification (Commerce Control List)
  • License exceptions and determination
  • Deemed export compliance
  • End-use and end-user screening

Security & Governance Frameworks

Information security management, audit, and IT governance standards

ISO 27001:2022 CRITICAL

Information Security Management System (ISMS)

14 Control Clauses (Annex A):
  • Organizational controls (8 controls)
  • People controls (7 controls)
  • Physical controls (16 controls)
  • Technological controls (46 controls)
  • Total: 93 controls (reduced from 114)
Certification Requirements:
  • Stage 1 audit (documentation review)
  • Stage 2 audit (main assessment)
  • Surveillance audits annually
  • Recertification every 3 years
SOC 2 Type II HIGH

Service Organization Control - Trust Services Criteria

5 Trust Services Criteria:
  • Security: Protection against unauthorized access
  • Availability: System availability per SLA
  • Processing Integrity: Complete and accurate processing
  • Confidentiality: Protection of confidential information
  • Privacy: Collection, use, retention of personal info
Report Types:
  • Type I - Point in time
  • Type II - Over period (minimum 6 months)
CIS Controls v8 CRITICAL

Critical Security Controls - 18 safeguards

Three Implementation Groups:
  • IG1: Essential cyber hygiene (56 controls)
  • IG2: Enhanced security (74 controls)
  • IG3: Advanced security (153 controls)
18 Controls:
  • Inventory, Secure Config, Data Protection
  • Account Management, Access Control, Audit Log
  • Email/Web Protection, Malware Defense
  • Data Recovery, Network Infrastructure
  • Network Monitoring, Network Management
  • Security Awareness, Service Management
  • Vulnerability Management, Incident Response
COBIT 2019 HIGH

IT Governance and Management Framework

5 Governance Principles:
  • Creating value for stakeholders
  • Holistic approach to enterprise IT
  • Dynamic governance system
  • Tailored to enterprise needs
  • End-to-end governance organization
40 Core Processes:
  • EDM - Evaluate, Direct, Monitor (5 processes)
  • APO - Align, Plan, Organize (13 processes)
  • BAI - Build, Acquire, Implement (11 processes)
  • DSS - Deliver, Service, Support (6 processes)
  • MEA - Monitor, Evaluate, Assess (5 processes)
